bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
tigervnc-server-1.7.0-4.fc24.x86_64
what about doing a "systemctl daemon-reload" on your local machine and read your logs before spit broken systemd-units to fedora repos?
this is a idiotic bug introduced by just careless write comments without verify waht somebody is doing
[root@srv-rhsoft:~]$ cat /usr/lib/systemd/system/vncserver@.service # The vncserver service unit file # # Quick HowTo: # 1. Copy this file to /etc/systemd/system/vncserver@.service # 2. Replace <USER> with the actual user name and edit vncserver parameters appropriately
Nov 26 22:04:13 srv-rhsoft systemd: [/usr/lib/systemd/system/vncserver@.service:6] Missing '='. Nov 26 22:04:13 srv-rhsoft systemd: [/usr/lib/systemd/system/vncserver@.service:6] Missing '='. Nov 26 22:04:14 srv-rhsoft systemd: [/usr/lib/systemd/system/vncserver@.service:6] Missing '='. Nov 26 22:04:15 srv-rhsoft systemd: [/usr/lib/systemd/system/vncserver@.service:6] Missing '='.

> Bugs: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/1397207 - Missing instructions for TigerVNC > Notes: Improve description in tigervnc service file
oh yeah . please leave us in peace at all with such non-function-related updates especially when they spam logs but even without - nobody needs such cosmetic builds

damned
Nov 29 15:26:09 srv-rhsoft systemd: [/usr/lib/systemd/system/vncserver@.service:6] Missing '='. Nov 29 15:26:09 srv-rhsoft systemd: [/usr/lib/systemd/system/vncserver@.service:6] Missing '='.
I assume you have never done a stupid mistake that you sound so confident. I didn't expect to break something with this change so that's why I didn't test it. Sorry for that. The fix is coming.
tigervnc-1.7.0-5.fc25 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 25. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-222c39bd34
tigervnc-1.7.0-5.fc24 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 24. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-9b7e5a1bd3

First i eat my own dog food and read my mails so that in case of such a trivial fix i would have responded within 5 minutes or less with a koji link
Second i am known as fanatic when it comes to code formatting so that this would never have happened
No, i never touched a systemd-unit without reload systemd and look in the syslog especially when it's not my machine - but you are not the only one - bugs which can be easily found by grep dmesg and syslog for warn/errir/fail are pretty common in the Fedora wirkd
*** Bug 1400628 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

tigervnc-1.7.0-5.fc25 has been pushed to the Fedora 25 testing repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report. See https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for instructions on how to install test updates. You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-222c39bd34

See https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for instructions on how to install test updates. You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-9b7e5a1bd3
tigervnc-1.7.0-5.fc25 has been pushed to the Fedora 25 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
tigervnc-1.7.0-5.fc24 has been pushed to the Fedora 24 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
